description: ERECTION OF TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The developments to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match the original facing materials of the existing buildings in type, colour, dimensions and in the case of brickwork, bond, coursing and pointing.  Reason for condition: To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the development.

Condition : 3 - No structure including plant, water tanks, equipment or machinery shall be placed, erected or installed on or above the roof or on external walls without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: In order not to prejudice the visual appearance of the building or visual amenities of the area.

Condition : 4 - Before the building/extension hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the eastern elevation of the extension shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.  Reason for condition: To protect the privacy and amenities of occupiers of adjoining residential properties.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Permitted Development Order 1995 (or any other Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no windows or other openings other than those shown on the approved plans shall be formed in the eastern or western elevations of the extension without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To protect the privacy and amenities of the occupiers of adjoining residential properties.
